titles: The contented cuckold: or, The fortunate fumbler. Being a brief relation of a young spark, who marryed with a beautiful maiden, and on the wedding-day, received the sum of 500l. as her portion, with promise of as much more at the birth of her first child, but he being insuffieient [sic] to perform, resolved to hire his neighbour Robin the milker, to help him out at a dead lift. Tune of, Ladies of London. This may be printed. R.P.
publisher: Printed for J[ohn]. Back, at the Black-Boy on London-Bridge, near the draw-bridge.,
notes: Verse: "There was a beautiful damsel of late ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
